Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: kagome999
Reviews.Content: We were looking for accommodations in a good location, but for a reasonable price for the weekend in Montreal. This was the perfect place. Location - walking distance to the core of downtown. Saved us from driving and having to look for parking downtown Rooms - older, but spacious and had everything we needed. It included breakfast in their cafeteria, which had a great selection of food (omelette, bacon, cereal, fruits, etc). There were several conferences going on that weekend at the residence hall, so it was pretty busy. We didn't find it noisy though. I'd recommend this for anyone who is looking for accommodations at a good location for an affordable place and don't mind older furniture.

Reviews.Title: “good location in the city”
Reviews.Author: magmack842
Reviews.Content: The McGill New Residence Hall offers easy access to the attractions of a wonderful city. You won't get the amenities of a major hotel, but you'll get a great price, a nice breakfast, and friendly college-age staff. We spent most of our time in Montreal out in the city, so the lack of frills at the hotel was fine for us. We could walk to restaurants, museums, and beautiful neighborhoods. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for lower price”
Reviews.Author: ak7sailor
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the underground and downtown area as well as the park. Close to shops and restaurants as well as cafes

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: xsenia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in order to attend my cousin's wedding. This was not my choice, but had been preselected by them for everyone to stay at, so we could all be in the same place. We walked in and immediately were met with swarms of teenagers, all drinking and being boisterous in the lobby. There was one staff member taking care of all the check ins so it made for a long line up. The rooms are used as dorms during the school year, so they are equipped with two desks. The room was run down, the beds were not adequately supported and we had to put a garbage bin under the one side of the bed to kept it flat. This place is like a hotel that has been run into the ground. Cigarette burns in the carpet, torn wallpaper etc. It looked like what you'd expect after 8 months of partying and no upkeep. I would stay here if I was going to Montreal to party with friends, not for any other purpose. If you're a group of teens- mid 20's looking to party, this is a perfect place. If you are looking for something better taken care of and want to sleep, then look somewhere else. The price may be right, but I looked on booking.com while we were there and I found way nicer hotels for the same price. Make the effort and find a better hotel. The location is good but not great. There are so many better hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and decent location”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room for me and my girlfriend on the Civic Holiday long weekend in August. Our room was not really clean, but at least our beds were clean and the sheets were white. We found some spit-ball stains on the ceiling and a huge stain on the ground. We basically just walked around our room in our outdoor shoes - which was fine I think. The bed side lamps won't work as it was not plugged in and the outlets were behind the bed. The washroom had hairs stuck on the walls - it was atrocious. But it at least had the basic amenities: two desks and chairs for each of us to use our laptops, and free wifi with a strong signal throughout the room. As our roommates, we had someone playing their guitar in the hallway at 11 pm - waiting with their luggage. I would had gave him a dollar if I had one! And around 5 pm in the afternoon, a guest were throwing up in the lobby washroom. They were certain interesting people! The hotel advertises parking under the hotel and can be reached via an elevator inside the hotel. While that was true, they did not advertise that you need to walk 5-10 minutes through two sets of elevators and through a plaza/food court before reaching your car. And parking was $19 per day. It's a closed lot, so it was relatively safe. The hotel also provided a $6 per person for breakfast (7-10am). For that amount, you could get a coffee, a toast, eggs and bacon or sausage. I think that was pretty average but we found out about the $6 credit after we took a bunch of stuff from their cafeteria. It's just like any university cafeteria where you grab your food and pay at cashier. We had to pay a bit on our first morning just because we didn't know about that. I guess in the end, we paid for what we got and the location was great so it even'd out. But I would pay a little bit more next time just to stay in an established hotel chain instead. Summary: The Pro's: - good location - cheap ($) - free WiFi - $6 credit per person for breakfast - air conditioner The Con's: - Dirty - Breakfast was university cafeteria quality - Not so great tenants

Reviews.Title: “Rather luxurious for a dorm, but great for a family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chienvertvert
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a spacious 2 double-bed room with private bathroom, on the 16th floor of this former hotel converted into a McGill University dormitory. We had fabulous views of Montreal, and a location just slightly out of the downtown area, and it was a very doable walk to the main campus. The public transportation was not very nearby, but we never missed it as we enjoyed the summer weather and walked all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, top notch location”
Reviews.Author: TripGalIowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the McGill University New Residence Hall for a one week vacation in July. Our primary factors in choosing it were: price, access to public transportation, and location. The NRH met our requirements in spades. If you're looking for 5-star accommodations, then McGill isn't for you. But, if you're going to have an active vacation, anticipate spending very little time in your hotel, and want very good accommodations, then McGill is for you. With easy access to the train, downtown, Mont Royal Parc, and the restaurants of St. Laurent, it was a real deal. (CAA and AAA members get an additional discount.) The rooms have large dorm-size refrigerators, which are convenient if you don't want to eat out all the time, and the NRC is conveniently located on the underground shop system. I would stay here again and I recommend it to others. The room rate also includes a $6 breakfast credit for each occupant, which only adds to the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: WoodYukon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Montreal with our 5 year old. The location is perfect, in the heart of downtown. 5 minute drive to Old Montreal. We were there on a weekend so drove our car to Old Montreal. You can find parking for 12 hrs for only $10 on weekends. If you want to save money, don't use the parking lot attached, for $19 per 24 hrs. On a weekend, we parked on the street (right in front of the residence) from 5pm to 9am the next morning for free. We then took our car to Old Montreal for the day. The parking garage has no in and out priveleges so can be expensive. The room itself was perfectly adequate. We had 2 double beds, TV, 2 desks and a small fridge. All of the staff members were extremely helpful with our questions. The room price also includes a $6 credit for breakfast in their cafeteria which is more than adequate. For less than that price we got scrambled eggs, bacon, homefries, apple juice and Montreal bagel. I would definitely recommend this place and would stay there again! Make sure you also get some bagels to take home!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for Grand prix”
Reviews.Author: JenCh23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the 2010 Canadian Grand Prix. All other hotels in downtown Montreal were very expensive!! The residence was very reasonably priced and was in an excellent location. Breakfast was provided in the caferteria (free up to $6) Am planning on going staying again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Value value value”
Reviews.Author: jonnyk331
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to save a buck, located on the northeastern fringe of McGill's campus about 0.75 km north of most of the downtown action. Definitely a great spot to say for Grand Prix weekend. About a 1 km walk to the nearest train station, and plenty of buses going by to get you around. Easily walking distance to St. Laurent or a short cab ride to Saint Catherines street for amazing bistro dining and bars, with clubs hidden here and there. We only used a cab to and from the airport as there is no other easy access unless you want to drag your suitcases onto the bus. Rooms were nothing special. Ordinary curved glass TV, an empty fridge which was a bonus (there is a Provigo or "Superstore" just south of the hotel), and a so-so bed. But for the money, you can't beat it! Definitely 5-star value. Staff were all excellent to interact with and very helpful. Will definitely stay here again for Grand Prix.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: soverdi
Reviews.Content: Good price for Montreal area. Bus stops near front of hotel and you can easily walk to downtown. Don't expect a king size single bed, since this is a student dorm after summer, and rooms are arranged for 2 room mates. Breakfast is limited to $6 worth of food in the cafeteria, then you pay on top of that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Value for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: travelRobbie
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Montreal several times it was a pleasure to stay at the McGill New Residence Hall. Formerly a hotel this Residence is now part of McGill University's Residences. It is located close enough to downtown Montreal yet still a few blocks away to get away from the noise of the downtown core. The New Residence Hall is within easy walk of all the major shops and the Metro. The Residence Hall is also connected to a neighbourhood mall with grocery stores, restaurants, bars, drug store and most of anything you would need. The room rate that I had also included a voucher towards breakfast in the Cafeteria. Depending on what you have this voucher will or could cover all the value of your breakfast. Lunch and dinner need to be outside the hall as the cafeteria is only open for breakfast. There are lots of neat bistros and restaurants in the area. When visiting Montreal I would recommend obtaining a OPUS card -- it is a rechargable card (like London's Oyster Card) It is good for travel on the Metro and bus system. Also if you are arriving in Montreal by air at Pierre Elliott Trudeau airport and do not want to take a taxi to town try the new 747 Express Bus. Currently the fare is $7.00 one way (cash only) and includes a 24 hour pass on the rest of the transit and metro. It operates 24 hours a day 7 days a week.

Reviews.Title: “Possible Bedbugs in Molson Hall”
Reviews.Author: Pelepassion
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Bishop Mountain Hall's Molson Hall and I had lots of bed bug like bites each morning I stayed there. However, I searched the room for all the signs of an infestation or for bugs and I didn't find any evidence. That being said the cinderblock walls leave lots of little places for the bugs to hide out. Since it's hard to say if it's a BB bite for SURE without evidence all I can say was I was getting bites at night and they weren't mosquito bites. There were also smears of blood on the sheets which is another sign of bed bugs. Upon looking when I got home other McGill residences have confirmed bed bug cases including the most public case in MORE. Aside from the bugs, the rooms were alright. Price was good. Staff weren't informative but nice. Apparently I got free breakfast (up to $5 each day and wasn't told until the last day after it ended - nice). Lack of knowledge about airport shuttles which ended up in me not getting a pickup shuttle back. No wifi access unless you stay more that 14 nights but free use of computers between 7am and 10 pm. I would prefer wifi personally. The view was great from my room... and since it's on a hill you can see a very lovely cityscape. They call this Bishop Mountain Hall for a reason.... you do have to travel up and down a hill to get there... which is very exausting after a long day of exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Sorsha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for over a week as part of a plan to recharge my batteries on a round-the-world trip. I'd been staying in shared hostel rooms and needed some time out on my own. McGill was just the place, offering single student rooms at a great price. The location was fantastic, rooms weren't too cramped and the breakfast was generous. The only downside was the lack of air conditioning. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for the tight budgeted traveller”
Reviews.Author: phildogg102
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel/hostel for the F1 Grand Prix weekend (RIP 1982-2008), it was the most affordable in town! This hotel was the Renaissance Hotel and was bought by McGill University. The rooms are standard hotel rooms with two queen beds. The difference is there are two desks and two wardrobes in the room(for the Masters students in the winter). There is wireless internet and cable tv. The location is close to subway stops and resturants/shopping/groceries. There is also breakfast served in the hotel everymorning. Under ground parking is available and is attached to the hotel making for an easy in and out. The Verdict: Though not quite a normal hotel, it is definatly the best spot to stay in Montreal for the budgeted traveler. No need for multi person Hostel rooms!

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay again”
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable place (use your AAA discount) in a very good location for exploring. Becuase of the varied taxes and higher touristy rates, the $5 free breakfast was welcomed. Be warned. If you get the prepared special (powdered scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fried potatoes, coffee or juice and sometimes baked beans, a pancake or a waffle), you will need some serious cholesterol medication. You can do the math up to $5.00 and select healthier choices such as fruit and yogurt. The days we had the prepared breakfast kept us fueled for many hours before we needed to think about food again. No coffee or tea in the rooms, but ironing board, blow dryer, refirigerator, etc. Not every amenity on every floor. We inquired and found the ice machine on the 5th floor. The converted hotel rooms offer lots of space and they provide daily maid service. No pool or gym, but you can get your exercise walking. Bus stops are in front and it's only about five blocks to the nearest metro station. Downstairs is a conveniently located post office, two grocery stores, shops to fix your hair or your shoes, and even a Dollorama for extreme budgeting. There is even a cinema with French and English films and some restaurants. The staff is very friendly but don't mistake them for concierges. They will give you their best guess as to where something is or the time for something, etc., but they gave me some incorrect information and I heard them do that to others, too. Two free internet stations, one of which works sporadically. Close to the base of Mount Royal and even fun to walk down Rue Arthur (close by to see the al fresco diners and musicians.) We bought food from the markets and had several picnic style meals thanks to the refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ywtchr
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a review of the NEW RESIDENCE HALL on 3925 Avenue du Parc. The lobby is nice. Cafeteria is typical of a university - overpriced, average-tasting food, several places to sit, but you do get a $5 voucher towards breakfast (bring money down with you if you go over this amount because they charge tax on breakfast). The room was cute. Bathroom was decent although the wallpaper trimming around the top of the ceiling could be re-done but I've been in worse. Be sure to show your AAA or CAA upon arrival cause booking online doesn't automatically mean the discount is applied automatically. It'll save you at least like $10-$11. Of course, remember in Canada you pay 2 taxes which add up to like 15% of your bill....which is insane but if you save receipts and get the tax refund form from tourist offices or government site you can at least get that amount back if you're not from canada.
